experiences: Lead software tester for packaging structure and camera components on BlackBerry IVY In-Vehicle Platform, performing full feature and regression test cycles for 5 IVY product releases on Linux and QNX platforms.

Designed an in-vehicle Android app in Java (Android Studio) to retrieve insights via an Android bridge, and programmed C++ data connectors to provide sensor and camera data to a Python-based synthetic sensor.
Automated 70% of test cases with Python, halving time bandwidth, and managed automation pipelines and code reviews in GitLab.
Developed a prototype for a variable heating element using C on Arduino, reducing in-rush current by over 90%.
Programmed and prototyped a driver for an LED matrix panel on a Linux-based Raspberry Pi, enabling a noiseless electric fireplace.
Designed and modified test plans for device verification tests, reducing application bugs by 25%.
Developed a user interface for device testing software using C# on the Visual Studio .NET framework.
